website_summaries.verdict: A terrific microwave that is affordable, versatile, and simple to use.
pros: Comes with 14 preset cook menu items
Membrane keypad takes the guesswork out of using the microwave
Includes 10 power levels so you can heat various foods and beverages as much or as little as you choose
Features a 16.5-inch turntable that offers plenty of space
cons: Doesn't always heat up food evenly
Button design leaves much to be desired

customer_reviews.title: Don't be fooled by good reviews
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this microwave unfortunately I can't. It had great reviews so I decided to purchase it, however it only knows one cooking temperature. "Overcooked". The sensor settings did not work for me and the defrost button was a joke. I even entered under the product weight to hope that it wouldn't start to cook the edges of meat during defrost mode and it still didn't work. Terrible microwave don't waste your time or money.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Bea

customer_reviews.title: Unit failed after 18 months, Panasonic support non-existent.
customer_reviews.text: After about 18 months of use, the unit failed, and would not power on at all, even across multiple outlets. I went through Amazon to reach Panasonic support, and called the number listed. An automated message took my call, warned there would be a fee to talk to a technician if the unit was out of warranty, asked what I was calling about, and advised me to look up the closest service center before terminating the call. I never got a chance to speak to a human, and support was not helpful. Rather than waste time pursuing this with Panasonic, I will buy another brand after researching it.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey J. Schaller

customer_reviews.title: ... and so far is working well and doing a great job. This replaced our previous Panasonic that was ...
customer_reviews.text: Has been in use for one month and so far is working well and doing a great job. This replaced our previous Panasonic that was almost 15 years old before it died. In our experience Panasonic makes reliable microwave ovens.
customer_reviews.author: Hamarca

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: The obnoxious beeping (both volume & tone) is annoying; I dislike how many buttons need to be pushed to get it to simply turn on for a quick amount of time. After <1mth the door will not open w/o 1 hand prying while the other hand holds down the 'open door' button. I can't seem to get any answers via Panasonic website or customer service hotline. Even though the product is ugly, I bought it because the reviews were higher than other cheaply priced similar products; I regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: So far, so great
customer_reviews.text: Used this model to replace a builtin Jenn-Aire. Wider and shorter in dimensions, but I made it work. Big interior; logical, easy to use, controls. Light inside. Revolving glass turntable. If anyone would like instructions on how I made the additional necessary top/bottom trim parts for $20, just comment.
customer_reviews.author: Slim Chance

customer_reviews.title: Ominous Error 97 code less than 2 months after purchase
customer_reviews.text: Dead in less than 2 months. Ominous Error 97 code less than 2 months after purchase. Oven was sent to a certified repair shop. The inverter was bad, thus replaced. Upon receipt, the oven still did not work properly but now was a different issue (oven abruptly stopped mid cycle and turned off). The oven was again sent to the repair shop. I've yet to receive the microwave!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Died after 335 days of light duty
customer_reviews.text: I liked this microwave, except for two things: Even before it abruptly quit working, the door closes with a loud clanging noise which reminded me of a 1980's econobox car's door closing with deteriorated weather stips. I've had many microwaves over the decades and the noise of this one's door closure is downright obnoxious. But worse, it abruptly stopped working after 335 days. It consistently powers down after 2-seconds of starting. This is not my first Panasonic Inverter. But, I've never seen one die so prematurely.
customer_reviews.author: Victor in PC

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working and no one to fix
customer_reviews.text: It worked well for 7 months and now no power. Call Panasonic and can't get past automated service and they send me to a page on support that has no repair stations in a city of a million or so people. Of the places within 75 miles, two are permanently closed. I tried online chat but closed for the day. I will try tomorrow, but I am beginning to believe buying a Panasonic item was a huge mistake.
customer_reviews.author: John Maggio

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality product
customer_reviews.text: Turntable glass shattered during use; Panasonic refused to replace it; first time in 25 years of using different microwaves that this occurred. Door latch keeps sticking. Difficult to clean back wall due to curve. Low quality
customer_reviews.author: Regular Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Microwave died after six months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mother back in May of this year it stoped working by the end of October. Flashing a code H 97. I called customer support and the automated system told me they are experiencing high-volume and my weight maybe 20 minutes. Then it tells me that I may be charged $9.97 for the call! But I could chat with customer support for free and my Wait would only be about two minutes. So I went to their customer support Chat filled out the form. Push the request chat button and here I am 30 minutes later and no chat! Very frustrating experience so far!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 8 months
customer_reviews.text: We replaced our 20 year old Panasonic with the same brand. We were pleased with the product till today, 8 months later. Got a code H97. Panasonic wanted $7 to talk to tech support or chat from your PC for free. Tried but no luck with the chat
customer_reviews.author: Loscar69

customer_reviews.title: While the unit itself seems to be working well, ...
customer_reviews.text: While the unit itself seems to be working well, I am not impressed by the fact that the interior, white lining/coating is peeling off. At this point I'm just hoping that peelings don't fall into my food.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Ahl

customer_reviews.title: would not recommend, dead after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: It was nice while it lasted, has a huge interior, now arguing to get it repaired/replaced with Panasonic (and not going well) Got an H98 error on it last night, which essentially means it's dead. No local repair facility. Panasonic wants me to send it to them at MY cost, and yes this is a huge drawback to ordering online. At least with brick and mortar, you could bring it back in and not be out $50 for shipping it back. Used in the home, sporadically, maybe less than 1x per day.
customer_reviews.author: flamingoland

customer_reviews.title: Less than 2 years of use, then it's done.
customer_reviews.text: This microwave oven worked fine for less than 2 years, then it died. Seems to be power supply issue. I had a Samsung microwave that worked flawlessly for over 20 years. Extremely disappointed and won't be buying Panasonic again.
customer_reviews.author: BoBo

customer_reviews.title: Inverter Technology which doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I got this because of the Inverter Technology which happened to be useless. There is no difference between the power levels. Otherwise this is good quality microwave. The first unit was faulty - would shut down, but Amazon was very helpful and offered a replacement. Panasonic on the other hand, offered to fix it (did not offer even a temporary replacement), and I had to pay for shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Haimasoph

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: The unit was fine while it worked, but stopped working completely after just over a year.
customer_reviews.author: Stevie D.

customer_reviews.title: Unit worked fine for the first couple of weeks but now it's ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the third time this has happened with a Panasonic microwave in the past 18 months. Unit worked fine for the first couple of weeks but now it's only turning on for a couple of seconds and then it shuts off. I read that Panasonic microwaves have an issue with door latches and that could be the problem, but why should I have to replace the door latches after less than 2 months? Completely worthless. Never buying Panasonic again.
customer_reviews.author: Charles B.

customer_reviews.title: Best Microwave Oven Ever!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted the largest, most powerful microwave I could find. THIS is IT! I really wanted white but was only able to get black (which shows dust) but am pleased with it. This is so powerful I find myself using 1/2 power most of the time. It's amazing how much room this microwave has! I no longer need to cook/re-heat in shifts. I installed an over-the-range microwave 3 years ago and it's dead already. Over-the-range is handy in that no counter space is taken up but since I'm a bit on the under-tall side I decided to use up the counter space and get something I could reach and had the room I need.
customer_reviews.author: Bonkerz

customer_reviews.title: Will not be purchasing items like this from amazon anymore
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 3 months of very light use.I will never buy another panasonic product again...tried calling the customer support number listed through amazon and got to listen to some bs survey about vacations.Will not be purchasing items like this from amazon anymore.Tje size of this microwave was very nice.
customer_reviews.author: dee

customer_reviews.title: Typical microwave
customer_reviews.text: Don't believe the hype - centers still hot, large dishes still uneven temp, popcorn setting way off for all size bags.... As in you better not walk away or you will have a fire, i wish i would have taken a picture of the flaming popcorn bag. 2 stars, second star purely for the size of microwave, other than that do not spend the extra money here unless that is what you want.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy a Panasonic unit unless you want to buy a new one yearly.
customer_reviews.text: After owning this microwave than less than a year I received an error message H98 and no longer functions. When attempting to contact Panasonic’s customer support, the automated service tells me to visit their online service and when I attempt to do that I’m given yet another error message. I would not buy Panasonic products from Amazon as apparently neither one will support their products. Better to buy from a retail store like BestBuy where you have a chance for actual human help/refund/exchange etc. Very disappointed to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: Its best feature is it is powerful, cooks faster than previous one by a lot, besides that its not the best. No quick start buttons, which is a very much missed feature. Popcorn buttons dont work and burn the popcorn even if you set it to a smaller bag size than what you put in. Doesnt vent well, steam builds up on the window and just seems to stay there. I like the look and once you relearn your normal cooking times, if will save you some time. Expect to burn the top of your mouth until then. Over all I wouldnt buy again
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Hannon

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THIS!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I HATE THIS ITEM! It only lasted 3 months before we had to get another one! NOT WORTH THE MONEY!
customer_reviews.author: ForgottenFairy

customer_reviews.title: You can't replace the light
customer_reviews.text: This product works well for basic microwaving . I have had some success in cooking a whole chicken or small turkey breast . My biggest issue is that the LED light went out after less than two years and it is not a 'customer replacement' part . My nearest service center is two hours away , so I am screwed .
customer_reviews.author: Egolpis

customer_reviews.title: Door won't open after 45 days (fixed with a few techniques)
customer_reviews.text: The door won't open (unless you pry it open while pushing the open door button)... I've only had the microwave for 45 days (and it started becoming a problem 20 days ago but got much worse recently). Tried white lithium grease on the release mechanism... no luck. Next, I filed down one of the two "catches"... that keeps it shut. Then I slightly straighten the door (hingers and/or the connection must have been slightly off) by bumping the lower corner with my palm. This made it it was squared to the main body so it would shut without the possibility of rubbing. It works perfect now!
customer_reviews.author: Screwpop®

customer_reviews.title: 30 months. That's it.
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice, powerful microwave while it lasts. 30 months is all I got, which is frustrating for a unit that I replaced a 20 year old microwave with. I'm not expecting new gear to last that long, but I did expect more than 2.5 years. I hope you have a better life span than I did.
customer_reviews.author: Don Krause

customer_reviews.title: Works well; LED lighting works well; feels less substantial then the one we replaced
customer_reviews.text: I looked high and low for a microwave to replace our under-counter 10-yr old unit. This one ticked all the boxed--large capacity, medium-sized footprint, and plenty of advertised power. It is not a heavy unit-- the door and door's open button feel less than solid to me. The control panel layout is slightly confusing, and since this is under the counter, not having a backlit on the keys is a learning curve disadvantage. Overall, it is a 4-star unit. Heats well and evenly, but the design and components could be improved.
customer_reviews.author: christopher james

customer_reviews.title: A Great Big Microwave
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty large microwave at 2.2 cu.ft. and 1250 watts. The controls are easy to use, and it fit nicely under our upper shelves in the kitchen. It cooks quickly, so you have to cut back on cooking times a small amount. It did have a kind of sheet metal clunky noise when it opened, so I bought a rubber bump stop and put it on the bottom right of the door to cushion the slam noise. It worked. For the price, this is an excellent buy!
customer_reviews.author: D. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Troublesome
customer_reviews.text: Shuts off 5 seconds after starting. Sometimes it doesn't shut off at all without heating. No matter what button you press it won't shut off you have to unplug it. I would have upgraded but only the Panasonic models were available and I was concerned that the problem was systemic, so I returned the item. I will say this, returning couldn't have been any easier. Amazon took all of my frustrations and made it a pleasant experience.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony G

customer_reviews.title: I like this microwave
customer_reviews.text: I like this microwave. We had difficulty finding one that was big enough, very good reviews and had the features we wanted. It's bigger than we actually wanted, but nothing else made sense. It works great, heats well, we like it. Just a bit too big and one dumb thing. The button to reset the clock is right above the start button. "Really?", who does that? One thing it's missing we liked in our prior microwave was a timer to beep one minute later after cooking was done to let us know the "Let stand one minute" was up.
customer_reviews.author: ChefSparky

customer_reviews.title: Died completely in less then 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Well it worked pretty great for the time I had it. Room, built well and easy to clean. Although within 3 months it has died completely. I am no microwave mechanic so I don't know what the issue is but for the price you pay it shouldn't be dead within in 3 months lmao.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Greene

customer_reviews.title: Works great and lots of power.
customer_reviews.text: It replaces a previous Panasonic 1250 Watt Inverter Microwave which lasted me 13 years. This new model works just the same and had the same dimensions and functions. The only slight negative is the QUICK button in now 30 seconds instead of the nice 1 minute per press.
customer_reviews.author: Bra

customer_reviews.title: Requires 20amp fuse
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had a microwave in years. I unwrapped and started reading instructions. Only then do I discover that it requires a MINIMUM 20 amp fuse. This apt has all 15 amp. Have to return. They should make this clear up front. I went back and looked and no where do I see in the details... I have no idea when appliances started requiring more than 15 amp... Given the pain, etc., to return, I deduct 2 stars, but I emphasize that I never used it.
customer_reviews.author: PlatoLover

customer_reviews.title: It’s a great microwave oven. No regrets!
customer_reviews.text: I read many reviews before buying this oven. I was concerned about the size so I took colored electrical tape and marked out its outline on my counter. I lived with the imaginary microwave on my counter for two weeks and realized it wasn’t that much bigger than my old one. I’m very happy with it. It’s quiet and super efficient. I can fit two small sandwich plates in side by side and cook on the same plates I serve on. There’s plenty of light inside, it doesn’t have that annoying persistent beeping, it pops popcorn like a champ and I love the 30 second feature.
customer_reviews.author: bosvold

customer_reviews.title: Nice powerful microwave with lots of room
customer_reviews.text: The only complaint I can make is that the soft touch keypad is not defined well so the individual "buttons" (especially start and stop) do not stand out. Otherwise this is a great powerful microwave. The inverter technology is so much better than that pulsed for short burst method of other units. I did have to experiment with the timing of microwave popcorn. A few seconds too much will burn it. My old one took 2:00 minutes to pop a bag of my favorite brand but this one only takes 1:19.
customer_reviews.author: rick

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Microwave, and YOU CAN TURN THE BEEPER OFF !!!
customer_reviews.text: GREAT microwave ! ... I've owned several microwaves, and a big old Panasonic was my favorite, years ago ... I chose this NN-SN936W model and I am happy to announce YOU CAN TURNOFF THE BEEPER !!! ... every time it is plugged in, it displays a short setup screen, and one of the options is to turn off the beeper ... the controls are simple and convenient to use, the inverter provides a fairly quiet and smooth flow of cooking power ... it quickly arrived, packaged well, and damage-free ... I would buy it again in a heartbeat !
customer_reviews.author: J. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Horrible customer service!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Six weeks after I purchased the microwave, I was popping a bag of popcorn and the glass tray broke in two. I had only used the microwave about 20 times. Amazon said it was past the 30 day exchange period so I had to contact Panasonic. After about a month of dealing with four different divisions at Panasonic through over a dozen emails, over 20 phone calls and several online chat sessions, they said it wasn't covered under the warranty and that I would have to pay $40 to have it replaced. Will never do business with Panasonic again!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Helmer

customer_reviews.title: All Round Great Oven
customer_reviews.text: For a small home “good things come in small packages”. They don’t just say, but they do reduce the electronics space without cutting down on the bells & whistles. As you can read in description, this is fully functional with a larger cooking area than other ovens with the same dimensions as a result of Shrinking the electronic compartment. Reporting the flaws is easy; I can’t find one! Obviously I highly recommend this oven
customer_reviews.author: John Spears

customer_reviews.title: Large size capacity
customer_reviews.text: Largest size I found, perfect for all my large casserole dishes. Works great and is fast. I miss my old microwave that had express defrost and defrost for common items like butter, cream cheese and ice cream. The plus timer is worthless as it only works once the microwave has stopped. You cannot add time to a item that is already cooking. This does not help at all when you are trying to make popcorn. No easy set buttons like a 30 sec button. Good value for the money, wouldn't buy this microwave if there were any other choices available when I purchased this one. If you just use to warm up items this works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Horst

customer_reviews.title: Cludgy User Interface
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe anyone would design an appliance today and require the operator to press two or three additional buttons for one simple operation. The only quick start button is the 30 sec. button All the rest require pushing start as well at a minimum. For example, heat two minutes = push 2, push 0, push 0, and push start. The eight year old microwave I replaced had buttons 1 through 6 designed as push and start. I never dreamed I had to check for quick start features. The box is well designed and the cavity is white and bright and it heats well without scorching.
customer_reviews.author: Gtown

customer_reviews.title: Super microwave!
customer_reviews.text: I did research before buying this and it got great reviews. It's versitale, roomy, cooks/heats very quickly, easy to clean, and super easy to use and I've been very happy with it. I only gave 4 stars because the liner on inside of door is defective on my microwave and has a permanent wrinkle that gets moisture in it, and I forget things in the microwave at times because after something finishes cooking it beeps but then the screen goes blank and doesn't continue to show a message to remind me my food is still in it. Mostly a problem when I defrost and forget I put the food in until later.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Quality control issues abound for this product...
customer_reviews.text: Package was not damaged, however, whomever packaged this microwave paid no attention to the obvious bent door frame, bent frame behind the door, crushed and jammed Upper door switch, and the skewed and crooked touch pad installation. It would not start and could not start based on the assembly. Worse I’ve ever seen in a supposedly “from the factory” product. I packed it up and sent it back immediately. No one should ever receive a product so poorly presented. It seems they wanted the crappiest rating ever. I’d give it a negative rating if it was possible. Greg
customer_reviews.author: Greg Pollet

customer_reviews.title: Item stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this microwave, because of the brand name and product reviews. Don't be fooled like I was. The died almost a year to the day. The microwave was not in heavy use. I mainly used it for popcorn and heat frozen dinners and thaw veggies. In the user manuals it talks about moisture issues. It's a microwave oven that has problem with moisture . Really!!!! Maybe used it once or twice a week for a few minutes. Don't buy it. Not a good product, waste of money.That is it's a piece of junk. Very disjointed. JUNK....
customer_reviews.author: walt2390

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful microwave
customer_reviews.text: This is the newer version of the microwave we replaced. There are a few updates that we really like. The one touch button changed from one minute to 30 seconds and if needed can be hit twice for a minute. The sensor cook options increased and now includes fish and fresh veggies. It is a large capacity high wattage micro so heats very fast on full power. We often use the option to decrease power when cooking/heating seafood. All in all this microwave is great and the functions are very intuitive.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith

customer_reviews.title: Cooks fast, large
customer_reviews.text: Very large, make sure that you have the space for it. Cooks very fast. Lots of options. The only downside so far is that when you click the Add 30 Seconds button you still need to click the Start button. I am used to microwaves that will start automatically after a few seconds. Maybe that is another safety feature that was required by the government? Just a change from other units I have used.
customer_reviews.author: Donald A. Desmith

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS THE ONE YOU WANT
customer_reviews.text: i never realized different microwaves could be so different. this bugger works, and does so in half the time. warning though if you have been using a less powerfull microwave for years like i have you will have a learning curve with this one and will overcook a few things. what use to commonly take a minute to cook will be turning into a burnt little crisp or blown up mess with a full minute in this microwave. super powerful . who knew ?
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, lasted about two and a half years
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this microwave in October of 2017. It served our needs well -- no one in our family (we all used it) complained. In February of 2020, it stopped working and displayed an error message that the local repair person said was more or less fatal -- that is, the high cost of repair would be better spent on a new microwave. Two and a half years is kinda short, but I have come to understand that this is the trend. So happy to be helping the planet.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Austin

customer_reviews.title: Man alive, what a microwave!
customer_reviews.text: My old - and I mean OLD microwave died so I went searching for a new one. The old one had a 12" turntable; this one has a 16" turntable yet is only an inch or two larger outside overall than the old dead one. Cooks beautifully, no hot/cold spots. As I'm about older than dirt, I'm hoping this microwave purchase is my last one. It's terrific!
customer_reviews.author: JMac

customer_reviews.title: Very nice microwave and lots of room
customer_reviews.text: I have a big family so the size is perfect. I gave 5 stars for thickness because the outside is thin and allows more room on the inside for cooking. It is high powered so I need to get used to it cooking faster than my last microwave but that's a good thing and I read the directions so I didn't have problems because of that
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Last about a year.
customer_reviews.text: This was a great Microwave for a little over a year. Then it would sound like its on but wouldn't heat or show no numbers ,only lights, on the digital screen. Pretty lame that the warranty was only 1 year. Time for another machine and this time it won't be Panasonic.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: So far we love it!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this microwave to replace one that had developed a crack in its door. This one is larger (2.2 cu ft), which required a different approach to location in our kitchen, but it is much better where it is on top of the counter rather than above our heads. As far as what it can do, we are VERY pleased with its performance. It is fairly energy efficient, which encourages us to use it more to conserve energy and still produce wonderful tasting, properly cooked or heated foods. Hopefully it will last a long time so we can enjoy it that much more as we learn how to cook the microwave way whenever possible.
customer_reviews.author: P. House

customer_reviews.title: It’s a nice large microwave oven
customer_reviews.text: It’s a nice large microwave oven. Even the pizza box fits in it. Only 2 cons. 1) door doesn’t open when the open button is pressed and appear to have a stickiness. So need both hands to open the door (which is not very practical when one is trying to load in some food). 2) there is no quick time starts. Even 30 second option needs to be selected then have to press start. No one click heating. Other than these two, haven’t had problems over the last couple of months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Pavi

customer_reviews.title: Super New Microwave!
customer_reviews.text: I have to be honest - I love this microwave! We did a lot of research before purchasing (we had owned a Panasonic before that still worked but we needed to update.) This one is larger in size and MUCH stronger in power. If an object has a recommended cook time - cook below that and check the item. if needed heat more, but it will likely never be needed. There are several preset cook time buttons. Any questions feel free to ask...very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Wicked Photo Girl

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy button to open the door, lack of Express Cook functionality, and especially: Annoying loud beeps when cancelling cooking before time runs out, as well as when resetting time to zero. Regarding this last point (the annoying loud beeps)... Panasonic, there is no need to have loud, annoying, extended beeps ... because in both these user operations (cancelling cooking, and resetting time) THE USER IS RIGHT THERE AT THE MICROWAVE DOING IT ON PURPOSE! There is no need to make the rest of the household hear that! If this is user configurable, then let me know, I will update this review to be somewhat softer.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Love

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I love my new microwave. It's a little bigger than my old one, which was a Kenmore. It heats everything up in very short period of time, and so far has not overcooked anything or left anything cold. I like the keep warm setting, which you can set the time, so all the food is warm at the same time. Less expensive than some of the others and so far it has lived up to my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: V. ARCHER

customer_reviews.title: Top quality
customer_reviews.text: This is the most user friendly microwave to use for reheating meals. Just press the "reheat sensor" button and press "start" and when it beeps "two times" your meal is reheated to the correct temperature. Note: The reheat sensor detects steam and then beeps twice. It is very handy to also order the food cover for heating or cooking meals.
customer_reviews.author: JGE

customer_reviews.title: Cooks evenly and reheated food stays warm longer
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Due to the inverter heating, reheated food stays warm longer than with other microwaves I've used in the past. Need to keep the guide handy to use the sensor cooking/reheating, Although it doesn't have a popcorn setting for 3.5 oz popcorn bags, the 3.0 setting works well. Con: Due to it's light weight, it moves easily. After pressing the button to open the door, I usually pull it away from the wall. Despite this issue, the light weight makes it easy to pick up/move.
customer_reviews.author: Vonnie Cakes

customer_reviews.title: 100% satisfied.  Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I had another one just like this for probably well over 20 years. I like the larger size for my family. Fits larger casserole dishes and such. When it finally died, I decided to replace it with the same size and brand. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Little Short Italian Momma

customer_reviews.title: Works. Can turn off beeps.
customer_reviews.text: One of the reasons we chose this one is that you can turn off the beeps. Sure would be nice if manufacturers would beautify their sonic indicators. I think a nice addition would be that you could turn off the multiple beeps for when something is done cooking, but still have a quiet little click for when a button is depressed, like what cell phones do. Otherwise the unit works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: T. A. Lenz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for me
customer_reviews.text: This is a large microwave, but is a perfect size for me. It is also has more power than most so it will quickly heat/cook your food. The sensor reheat and sensor cook button options work very well, but be careful with the reheat option. I find that it can overheat certain foods - at least for my taste. The sensor cook option requires you to enter a number for the type of food you're cooking so be sure you don't lose the manual that comes with the oven - it has the chart with the numbers matched to the foods. The oven cleans up very easily and the price/value was excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Mark F

customer_reviews.title: Second one
customer_reviews.text: I loved the one we bought for our kitchen so much that we got a second one for the basement kitchenette to replace a low power, smaller model. Easy to clean, cooks amazingly fast, and is very quiet. I do miss my one-touch start feature, but worth it for the speed and huge interior.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Steinert

customer_reviews.title: Great=microwave
customer_reviews.text: The one feature I love above all the rest and there are many is the automatic reheating of foods. No more getting 5oo little time and having cold food, to too much and having a dried out meal. The microwave automatically senses when food is just the right tempera5ure and shuts itself off. Bravo!
customer_reviews.author: Iris

customer_reviews.title: We recommend!
customer_reviews.text: No melt button like for butter. I like how easy it is to decrease the power on it so it does melt the butter. There are ways to figure things out. So far we like our choice. We researched for quite a while and this microwave was the best value without sacrificing quality. We recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Spacious Inside
customer_reviews.text: The older version of this microwave finally quit after 12 years of daily use. Bought the newer version and couldn't be happier. It's huge inside without be much larger on the outside. I've had no problems with the door as other reviewers have. Not with the old one or the new one. Highly recommend this microwave. I didn't have to reprogram myself to use it either, it operates like the old one, a big plus.
customer_reviews.author: Zig

customer_reviews.title: excellent microwave
customer_reviews.text: Bought this microwave to replace a older version of the same unit that had finally died. Only fault was ordering from Amazon, took 14 days to ship it got it in 2 days but, 2 weeks to ship?? Microwave is excellent just like my previous model. completely satisfied with Panasonic, not Amazon..
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Samson

customer_reviews.title: I knew the product name's made great value microwaves in the past...
customer_reviews.text: I knew I was buying a good valued micro oven...I had been using it for around 6 months now, and I have had great service with it...It has many different stages for each button on it, which is great...There is a menu to use to know which stage is present for each dish...In the past good ovens lasted like 4 years...The name brand on this one, I generally got like 4- 7 years of service with these...It is easy to clean...The size is another thing I like about it too...At the moment, I can't say enough about it...It was worth my price...
customer_reviews.author: Theodore Petty

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! Works great for big family's and cooks evenly!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! This is great for big families, It's very easy to use and cooks evenly so no hot spots.
customer_reviews.author: BeHappy

customer_reviews.title: More Options,  Better Meals
customer_reviews.text: This is so much better than my prior microwaves. Presets actually improved our meals and the 3 levels for popcorn means my son no longer burns it. Food is heated more evenly too. If you are looking for a microwave with a small footprint, this isn't the one for you. It is perfect for large casseroles and other dishes.
customer_reviews.author: C. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice - great value - works like a champ!!
customer_reviews.text: Really love this microwave. It is very user friendly and the preset operations are easy to use and they cook the food just right. This replaced a much more expensive GE Profile with a broken door latch that rendered the microwave DOA. So much happier with our new Panasonic!!
customer_reviews.author: DocOnline

customer_reviews.title: WORKS WELL
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy, good microwave. It looks good, is very powerful, and can hold larger dishes. No complaints whatsoever. It's the second I've bought. After six years, something burned out in the original one I had, probably just a small fuse. (I will donate that one to a group that can repair it.)
customer_reviews.author: Anomaly 70

customer_reviews.title: Does not work properly
customer_reviews.text: We really wanted a microwave for popping popcorn and some other microwavable dishes. This model doesn't pop the popcorn entirely or if it does burns it every time no matter what popcorn setting is selected or simply using the clock time function. Unfortunately, we just were able to use it as we had to wait for the basement to be finished and now the return to sender is unavailable. I know Panasonic delivers quality products, just not this one. Maybe it's a lemon microwave? I'd like to swap it out/recommend a different model.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan S.

customer_reviews.title: Big and powerful
customer_reviews.text: This microwave is very nice as far as technology and power. It easily fits large items, warms up leftovers perfectly and has enough power to heat any food or drink quite quickly. Beware: this microwave is huge...of course it has to be to hold a turkey. But if you have limited counter space or only a narrow shelf to put it on, this microwave probably won't fit properly. All in all, I do love it. Works great - just bigger than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Candace Morehouse

customer_reviews.title: This is the gem!
customer_reviews.text: After trying out a whole bunch of microwaves on Amazon and returning them this was the one that made it to the top. Very highly rated since 2002! It would be a big mistake if they Ever discontinued this model it is superb.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Large interior, easy to use but door release annoying
customer_reviews.text: This microwave holds large items easily and is easy to program. My only complaint is the door release button. On other microwaves I've had, the button pops the door open. On this unit, the button releases the door, but you have to use your other hand to pull the door open. I don't know if this is a manufacturing defect or by design, but either way it is very annoying. I would have given 5 stars otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: bxmye

customer_reviews.title: Just as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Replacing a previous one just like it with the exception that the previous one when new had an issue with the door being a bit loud as it closed. This one is easy and quiet as it closes. I also love the feel of the touchpad since the buttons are slightly raised and I can feel that the button was pushed so that I don't hit it twice and set the microwave for 11 minutes instead of 1. This microwave is also very easy to clean with smooth, rounded corners. Overall, nothing to complain about.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: BRITT
customer_reviews.text: Had the same make and size for about 8 years door latch messed up so I ordered a new one I ordered the door latch and installed it (easy fix) then gave it to my daughter Still working perfectly
customer_reviews.author: James O'Neal Britt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent microwave for power and ease of use
customer_reviews.text: This machine is awesome in every way, except one: durability. We love this machine, the problem is I have needed to buy 3 in 10 years. I gave it one more chance because at my large office complex, there is one on every floor and they have lasted 7 years now with much higher usage than a home microwave...and they are all still kicking.
customer_reviews.author: John Shaughnessy

customer_reviews.title: Great microwave, beware white built in kits are not available
customer_reviews.text: We were pretty disappointed when the last microwave died after about 3 years, but are very very happy with this one. The variable heat output and sensor re heat are great features. I wish it hat a beverage button like the previous, but you cant have everything. Be aware that this cannot be used as a built in as advertised as Panasonic does not make a white built in kit anymore. I'm probable going to have to get a black kit and repaint it white :_(
customer_reviews.author: TK's

customer_reviews.title: Nice microwave
customer_reviews.text: Our last microwave had a lot more features, but we couldn’t find one that was the same. We bought this one and it does a good job for just a microwave. Reasonably priced, easy to clean and cooks a little faster than most recommended cook times because it’s 1250 instead of 1100 which seemed to be the standard .
customer_reviews.author: Karin

customer_reviews.title: Great Microwave
customer_reviews.text: The best microwave Its very similar to the Panasonic I had which lasted a very long time. Good make. This microwave looks good in white & very easy to use. Looks good, works well. I would recommend to anyone who needs a new microwave. The price was excellent also.
customer_reviews.author: Robin H.

customer_reviews.title: Its inverter technology and smart-sensor  work well together. The best microwave I ever had!
customer_reviews.text: It's timer digits are placed a bit strangely but easy to get used to. The door moves smoothly and I never bang it shut. I miss a door handle but the latch works smoothly. Its inverter auto-adjusted heating cycle and smart-sensor assure that food is not singed ever when heated for the prescribed time period. I use the 2000watt heating time for packaged food. The best microwave that I ever had!
customer_reviews.author: George I. Matkovits

customer_reviews.title: Large size. Sensor reheat works great.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Panasonic microwave, all basically this model. I blew the first two up microwaving a cup of liquid for an extended period of time. That is my only criticism. The size is great, I can fit an entire serving platter. Sensor reheat works awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Jason H.

customer_reviews.title: A hunk of junk!
customer_reviews.text: Worked a few (3 to 5) times for short one to three minute warm ups then died. Apparently a common problem that I was not aware of before ordering - I should have done better research.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: After just over a year, this microwave died. This is the third one that has died. The first one, my grandmother had for a month and it stopped working. She got a return and received a new one and then that died. Now, my mother’s has died and is making a sizzling sound. Never buying a Panasonic microwave ever again.
customer_reviews.author: MombieOB

customer_reviews.title: Ordering a Microwave Oven through Amazon
customer_reviews.text: During the holidays, has my old trustworthy "Panasonic" microwave go out on me. Went to a few major department stores where I normally buy my appliances at and just couldn't find the make and model(s) that would suite my needs. I took to the internet and "Amazon" offered a variety of makes and models, and was able to get exactly what I was looking for. Delivery was just three days; where the department stores was weeks out. I unpackaged the microwave and all was as expected. Set it up in minutes and was truly impressed just how quickly Amazon delivered. Shipping was free as well. I'm totally satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: GJD

customer_reviews.title: Meets Our Needs
customer_reviews.text: The design is pleasing. The instructions are easy. The cooking time is quite quick. The size is considerably larger than what we had previously (16" circular table vs 13.5"), but it fit perfectly into the recess.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wiedmann

customer_reviews.title: Good price, quality product!
customer_reviews.text: Larger inside capacity than our previous microwave but still fit in the same small space on the kitchen counter. Quality product that cooks well & runs quietly. Easy to use. Attractive design that matches almost any decor. We're very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Quality control
customer_reviews.text: Received the microwave, placed on the counter and noticed the the door window was warped in the middle bottom and had a gap. I’m sending it back. Poor quality control.
customer_reviews.author: M.Shepard

customer_reviews.title: This is the best microwave we have ever bought
customer_reviews.text: This is the best microwave we have ever bought. With more power, we have to dial back the time for such things as hot liquids. Inside is as big as the hood we used to use. We quit using those because they are so much trouble unmounting a dead one and remounting a new one, plus they cost more. Sure, this thing takes up counter space but you can't beat it for features and price.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa L. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Not happy. They could of done a better job for ease of use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a more expen=sive model cuz I wanted more levels of use. I got ripped off . And the manuel does not explain a whole awful lot. I moarn my last Panasonic microwave........it was far better. It also lasted 11 years. I seriously doubt this one will make it that far.
customer_reviews.author: Linda F.

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Love this microwave so much. The size is nice and large and it cooks great. I love the reheat feature and defrost. I think the invection technology is great. I haven’t found a single thing about this oven I don’t like. My first one however did have a defective door in that the door open button didn’t always work. I contacted Amazon and they were great in helping me get it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: and it is great. High power
customer_reviews.text: We have had this machine for a few months now, and it is great. High power, easy to use, just enough features that you feel like you've got a lot, but don't feel like you have more than you can use. My wife has been known to nuke an entire party pizza in the thing. The sensor does a great job with both reheating and defrosting. The display is clear and easy to read, and the machine isn't too noisy, considering the power it packs.
customer_reviews.author: Earthman

customer_reviews.title: Great microwave for the price
customer_reviews.text: This product is as advertised, fits perfectly where the old one used to be. It seems to heat things up faster and is a little bit quieter than our last one. The only bad thing I can say is it was a day late in arriving vs when they promised. We are very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Dembeck

customer_reviews.title: Wow!  Loving this microwave
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Larger than I expected but very impressive. The interior lighting is bright and awesome ! The large capacity increases my options on microwavable dishes and it cooks the food alot faster than my old microwave. I was very irritated when my 5 year old microwave died but the upgrade makes up for the annoyance - this one is great !
customer_reviews.author: D. S. ROGERS

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: Got the new Microwave to replace one that was about 20 years old. It has cooked, defrosted without cooking and reheated food beautifully. I had candidly forgotten how much "cooking" a good microwave will do. Fluffy eggs and omelets are a breeze. Veges stay al dente but are hot through. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Lefty

customer_reviews.title: Didn't heat a frozen meal.
customer_reviews.text: Tried for 3 days to get it to cook a small frozen meal. Never completely done. Still half frozen. bought to replace a 20+ year old Panasonic which never had a problem in 20+ years. Returned for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Disposable microwave
customer_reviews.text: Microwave lasted less than 2 years before we had issues. Microwave would power on but it would not allow any key entries other than to enter the time for the clock. Warranty is only 1 year. Repair estimate was 150.00. Cheaper to buy another microwave. We would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Tsriddle

customer_reviews.title: Fine microwave, but not quite perfect
customer_reviews.text: Some features that I like were missing from this Microwave. It also burned some food, because I followed package directions, even though I reduced the cook time.
customer_reviews.author: Judith

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic microwave ovens are very reliable,
customer_reviews.text: I have tried other brands of microwave ovens, but I have always found that Panasonic has a very reliable and durable product. My current purchases. The third Panasonic microwave. I have owned, the first one lasted well over 20 years, the second one took a lightning strike, The one I have now is working fine but it is on a surge suppressor. Highly recommended if you are in an area where there is a lot of thunderstorms.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Works nice.
customer_reviews.text: Nice. Best Microwave I ever had. But my last one was 15 years old so a lot of improvements since that one was made. Defrost is a delight. Havent' used sensor cook yet. everything about sensor cook is about "steam" sensing? and I am too unwilling to cook something uncovered and having to clean up splatters. States if something is covered up sense won't work?
customer_reviews.author: KDH4

product_meta.title: Panasonic Microwave Oven NN-SN936B Black Countertop with Inverter Technology and Genius Sensor, 2.2 Cubic Foot, 1250W
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Style Name:KeypadThis 2. 2 cu Ft. Large microwave oven features Panasonic patented Inverter technology engineered for even cooking and delicious results - no more overcooked edges or cold centers. Inverter technology delivers microwave energy in a way that allows delicate foods to simmer without overcooking. Foods retain more Color, texture and nutrients for fast, easy and delicious results. The Panasonic nn-sn936b offers 1250 watts of high cooking power and 14 preset auto cook menu items (sensor cooking Chart included in manual). one-touch genius sensor cook and reheat functions, takes the guesswork out of microwaving by automatically setting power levels and adjusting cooking or reheating time. Other highlights include a membrane keypad Inverter Turbo defrost technology, 10 power levels, popcorn button, keep warm mode, delay start, timer, quick 30Sec, 15" Turntable and more/less control. The countertop microwave oven measures 23 7/8" W x 14" H x 19 7/16" D and has a glossy Black finish. As a countertop microwave, The Panasonic nn-sn936b can rest on any open surface in the kitchen and can be easily moved. For a finished built-in look, order trim kit For 27” cabinet (Panasonic part # nn-tk922ss) or Trim kit For 30” cabinet (Panasonic part # nn-tk932ss) and install directly into pre-existing cabinetry space. Disclaimer: upper-inside left corner of microwave oven door has a small indentation to allow door to open smoothly. Do not store flammable materials next to, on top of, or in the microwave oven.
feature_bullets: Panasonic Microwave: This 1250 Watt high power, 2.2 cubic foot capacity black countertop microwave delivers a seamless stream of cooking power for even cooking and delicious flavor

Large Family Size: This countertop microwave with 16 1/2 inch turntable is thinner, lighter and more efficient, allowing you to devote less space to electronics and more to interior capacity; Internal dimensions (H x W x D): 10 15/16 inch x 18 7/16 inch x 18 1/2 inch

Smart Cooking Settings with Genius Sensor: Built in automatic Genius Sensor adjusts power and times based on different foods; Other advantages include 14 preset menu items, quick minute timer, delay start and child safety lock
Keep Warm Feature: This inverter microwave keeps soups, gravies or desserts warm and fresh until ready to serve. Clock: 12 H

Inverter Technology with Turbo Defrost: Patented Inverter Technology generates a seamless stream of power and delivers consistent, evenly prepared food without overcooking; Advanced Inverter Turbo Defrost speeds up defrosting time. Power Source 120V / 60Hertz. Power Consumption 1460W

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,473 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
